definition: to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: After reuniting, Jobs and Simpson developed a close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 在兄妹相认后，乔布斯和辛普森关系逐渐密切。

sentences.english: Crown male call Joseph with her?
We will recognize each other again and again, everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 我们将于任何地方，不断重新相认。

sentences.english: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph's kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.
sentences.chinese: 第二次约瑟与弟兄相认，他的亲族也被法老知道了。

sentences.english: Ma Dong and Zong Feng were being experienced kink and after sufferring, mother child admit eventually.
sentences.chinese: 马东和宗凤经历了着纠结和煎熬后，母子终于相认。

sentences.english: Almost forty years have passed since that day when I found my Roma again.
sentences.chinese: 从我们相认的那一天起，已经过了四十年了。

sentences.english: We would acknowledge each other amount the crowd in ten years.
sentences.chinese: 十年后的茫茫的人海里彼此相认。

sentences.english: 13On their second visit, Joseph told his brothers who he was, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph's family.
sentences.chinese: 第二次约瑟与弟兄相认，他的亲族也被法老知道了。

sentences.english: She didn't say he is her classmate and he looked like dared not say it out.
sentences.chinese: 她没有说他是她的同学，好像他也不敢相认。

sentences.english: Family reunion Joseph at the dock, hugs and cry.
sentences.chinese: 一家人在码头团圆相认，相拥而泣。

sentences.english: "Don't believe everything you hear, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “不要相认你听到的任何事情，”他说。

sentences.english: He wants his daughter and immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他想要立即和女儿相认。

sentences.english: And the second time his brothers had a meeting with Joseph, and Pharaoh had knowledge of Joseph's family.
sentences.chinese: 第二次约瑟与弟兄们相认，他的亲族也被法老知道了。

definition: to see each other/to meet in person
to visit new in-laws after a marriage
mother and child/parent and subsidiary (companies)/principal and interest
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
